section.title: vendor catalog costs for Vendor Catalog Costs
section.para: The Vendor Catalog Costs screen helps you manage your stock Items, when using data providers through the External Vendor Catalog. This screen displays the underlying data stored in the catcost table in your xTuple database. If the catcost table is populated with information and you update your Catalog, the Catalog will check the table first. If an Item has been added, then the Item and its purchased cost can be managed and updated from here.
To view and manage your Vendor Catalog Costs, select the "Vendor Catalog Costs" option. The following screen will appear.

The Vendor Catalog Costs screen displays pricing information related to Items in your Vendor Catalog. Item Master and Item Source records are both displayed here. Setting these records will prevent any costs in the Catalog from being updated. To update information for an Item, select the "Edit" option from the right-click menu.

note.para: If your pricing configuration is configured to "Use Wholesale Price for Unit Cost for Markups," then your sales commission is based on the Item's Wholesale Price. The catcost information can be used to manage those costs, as well, reflecting a true cost for commissions.
